description_parts.part1: After working as a mailman for 15 years, I decided to change paths and pursue a career in technology. I've always had a passion for computers, ever since I got my first one as a teenager. That interest has steadily grown over the years into a deeper understanding of how systems work and how to build things from the ground up.
description_parts.part2: Most of my skills are self-taught through hands-on projects and a constant drive to learn. I enjoy building backend systems, exploring APIs, and solving real-world problems — often by just digging into something and figuring it out along the way.
description_parts.part3: To formalize my knowledge, I studied backend development at Nackademin with a focus on Java and Spring Boot. I graduated with full scores, and you can view my diploma here: Nackademin Diploma.
description_parts.part4: Since graduating, I've started working professionally as a developer, continuing to build on everything I've learned — both in school and on my own. I still run personal projects and keep my home server running as a way to try out new ideas, learn new tech, and just have fun with development outside of work.
